name: Toasting Over It
description:
A physics based platformer, with a toast bread, searching its way home.
Inspired by "Getting Over It", so it can be difficult and/or frustating.

Toast bread:
  • One side is coated with jam - glues on everything.
  • The other side isn't - its slippery.
Movement:
  • You only need one button and a way to move the cursor.
    • e.g. by mouse, touchscreen, drawing tablet
  • Swiping through the toast while pushing the button, then releasing it,  will move the toast. 
    • Swipe length = strength
    • Swipe angle + position, of where you hit the toast = angle and rotation
  • You have 2 strong pushes followed by 1 light push before you can't do anything, until you get a reset.
    • The cursor displays the currently available pushes with dots .
    • Toast turns grey if only the light push is available.
    • Toast turns black if no pushes are available.
  • Resets:
    • Glue on something.
    • Don't move (or be very slow) for a short period of time, while beeing on the ground.
